intro: Cacalia auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate cacalia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals, often blooming in spring. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a hairy texture. Cacalia auriculata is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal regions.
